030422A-d-04-22-03-NYSW.Reporting Railroad Name: New York, Susquehanna & Western Railroad Company
030422A-d-04-22-03-NYSW.Contributing Accident Cause: Shoving movement, man on or at leading end of movement, failure to control
030422A-d-04-22-03-NYSW.Narrative:
TRAIN SU99 ON ITS ARRIVAL AT BINGHAMTON NY WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SHOVING INTO THE NYSW YARD FROM THENS MAIN TRACK, IN INTERLOCKING LIMITS IN THE EAST DIRECTION.  THE CONDUCTOR WAS PRECEDING THE MOVEALIGNING SWITCHES AS HE WALKED. THE CONDUCTOR GAVE THE ENGINEER INSTRUCTIONS TO BEGIN HIS SHOVE. THECONDUCTOR WAS ALIGNING MISALIGNED SWITCHES IN FRONT OF THEM (NOTE THAT THE CONDUCTORS BACK WAS TO THE TRAIN).  THE CONDUCTOR THEN HEARD A LOUD, HARD HITCH, TURNED AROUND AND THE TRAIN HAD GONE DOWN THE WRONG TRACK INTO THE NS MIDDLE YARD TRACK MAKING CONTACT WITH NS CARS THAT WERE OCCUPYING THAT TRACK, CAUSING THE TRAIN TO BUCKLE IN THE MIDDLE CAUSING 5 CARS TO DERAIL.  THE CONDUCTOR REALIZED THAT HE HAD MISALIGNED THE FIRST SWITCH COMING INTO THE YARD.
THE NS OWNS ALL TRACKS INVOLVED SO ANY REFERENCE TO TRACK IN THE ABOVE REPORT IS A N/A AND THAT INFORMATION WILL COME FROM THE NS REPORT.

SC0403109-d-04-11-03-BNSF.Narrative: HERDER (Y-LAC5311-10A) MADE FINAL COUPLING ON REAR END OF THE OUTBOUND Z-LACNYC9-11A TRAIN IN PROCESS POSSIBLY MADE A HIGH SPEED JOINT KNOCKING CAR TTAX 653561 OFF THE RAIL (TTAX 653561 DERAILED THENRERAILED ITSELF, NO DAMAGE) AND THEN PULLED DOWN TO SWITCH OUT A BAD ORDER AND IN DOING SO DRAGGING2 REAR CARS APPROX. 3000 FEET BEFORE STOPPING AND BEING AWARE OF SITUATION.  TTAX 553052 AND TTAX 653956 DERAILED EQUIPMENT.  HERDER WAS UNAWARE OF SITUATION UNTIL CAR INSPECTION INFORMED HIM OF THE CARS DRAGGING OR BOUNCING.  THIS TRAIN CONSISTED OF ARTICULATED CARS.  CAUSE COUPLING SPEED EXCESSIVE.

SC0403114-d-04-19-03-BNSF.Narrative: TRAIN M BARSDG1 18 PULLED INTO THE YARD BY A YARD CREW.  AFTER PULLING AHEAD SEVEN CAR LENGTHS, THEENGINEER SUSPECTED SOMETHING WAS WRONG.  THE TRAIN WAS INSPECTED AND FOUND SEVEN CARS DERAILED BEHIND THE POWER, NINE CARS WERE UPRIGHT AND THE REAR SIX CARS WERE DERAILED.  AFTER INVESTIGATION, IT APPEARS THAT A LOAD SHIFTED CAUSED THE DERAILMENT.

SC0403127-d-04-16-03-BNSF.Narrative: TRAIN Z-LACALT-016 WAS PULLING EAST OUT OF TRACK 114 TO SWITCH OUT A B/O CAR FROM THEIR TRAIN.  ABOUT 10 TO 15 MINUTES EARLIER, THE Z-LACALT ENGINEER NOTICED THE RIP JOB HEADING EAST.  HE SAW THE CARSAND PUT CUT INTO EMERGENCY.  HE STRUCK THE SIDE OF BRAN 4555 AT B WELL AND DERAILED C TRUCKS WITH THE FRONT RIDE SIDE (ENGINEERS SIDE) OF BNSF 5475.

NC0403100-d-04-03-03-BNSF.Narrative: YARD JOB Y-ST03031-02 WAS SHOVING 69 CARS AND 4861 TONS INTO 134 TRACK FROM THE WEST LEAD AT MORMONYARD.  THE ENGINEER ON THE JOB, HAD 15 POUNDS OF AIR SET ON THE INDEPENDENT AND HAD THE 4 LOCOMOTIVES IN RUN 5 ON THE THROTTLE CAUSING THE TWO EMPTY WALLBOARD CARS, TTZX 86859 AND THE BNSF 562296 TO LIFT INTO THE AIR.  WHEN THE CARS CAME DOWN THEY DERAILED.  NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS WERE RELEASED.

NW0403114-d-04-27-03-BNSF.Narrative: RC SWITCH JOB Y-EVE1012-27 WAS PULLING 44 CARS INTO 311 FROM THE NORTH END OF BAYSIDE YARD.  THE 43RD CAR ARMN 902148 1ST TRUCK CLIMB AND SPLIT THE RIGHT HAND CLOSED SWITCH POINT AS IT ENTERED TRACK 311.  THIS THEN CAUSED THE 42ND AND 44TH CAR TO DERAIL.

GC0403110-d-04-20-03-BNSF.Narrative: YARD ENGINE YPEA1011-20A WAS PULLING 16 EMPTY DOUBLE STACK CARS OUT OF TRACK 1431 TO DOUBLE OVER ONTO 14 DOUBLESTACK CARS IN TRACK 1432.  BNSF 237455 WAS EAST OUT IN TRACK 1431 AND WAS ON THE POINT OFTHE SHOVE.  AS THEY BEGAN TO DOUBLE OVER ONTO CARS IN TRACK 1432, BNSF 237455 DERAILED AS OR IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE JOINT WAS MADE WITH CAR AOK 55283 IN TRACK 1432., RESULTING IN ALL FIVE PLATFORMS ONBNSF 237455 LEAVING THE RAILS.  NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS INVOLVED, ALL EMPTIES.

KS0403104-d-04-11-03-BNSF.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to stretch cars before shoving
KS0403104-d-04-11-03-BNSF.Accident Cause: Failure to stretch cars before shoving
KS0403104-d-04-11-03-BNSF.Narrative: R KAN02311 11G SWITCHED 77 CARS OUT OF 4302 AND WERE SHOVING THERE CARS INTO 4305 TRACK WHICH HAD 72CARS IN THE TRACK AT THAT TIME.  THE CONDUCTOR MADE THE JOINT IN 4305 TRACK AND STRETCHED THE CARS52 FEET.  THE BRAKEMAN THAT WAS ON THE EAST END OF THE CARS, INDICATED HE HAD ALL THE CARS AND GAVEDISTANCE TO BEGIN SHOVING.  THE CONDUCTOR CLEARED THE CROSSING ON THE WEST END OF THE YARD AND STOPPED THE MOVEMENT.  THE BRAKEMAN FAILED TO NOTICE THE KNUCKLES WERE BUTTED BETWEEN TWO CARS AND HAD FAILED TO COUPLE 58 CARS FROM THE EAST END.  THIS CUT ROLLED OUT THE EAST END OF THE YARD AND DERAILED6 CARS ON THE SPLIT POINT DERAIL.  PLMX 30113 -STCC 4909305 - RELEASED 6,649 GALLONS AND PSPX 29478-STCC 4909305 RELEASED 3,585 GALLONS TOLUENE.

KS0403109-d-04-15-03-BNSF.Primary Accident Cause: Automatic hump retarder failed to sufficiently slow car due to foreign material on wheels of car bei
KS0403109-d-04-15-03-BNSF.Accident Cause: Automatic hump retarder failed to sufficiently slow car due to foreign material on wheels of car bei
KS0403109-d-04-15-03-BNSF.Narrative: THREE CARS DERAILED IN A CRITICAL PATH AT ARGENTINE YARD.  A TANK CAR LOADED WITH CORN SYRUP WAS HUMPED INTO A CLEAR BOWL TRACK, BOWL TRACK 2024, AND EXCEEDED REQUESTED LEAVING SPEEDS FROM THE HUMP MASTER RETARDER GROUP AND TANGENT RETARDER AS A RESULT OF BRAKE SHOES ON MASTER RETARDER HAVING BEEN FOULED WITH COTTONSPEED OIL FROM A CAR HUMPED 37 MINUTES EARLIER.  AS A RESULT OF THE THREE RETARDERSINABILITY TO CONTROL SPEED, THE LOADED CAR KNOCKED THE SKATE OFF EAST END OF BOWL TRACK 2024 AND PROCEEDED ON TO NORTH TRIM LEAD IMPACTING TWO RESIDUE TANK CARS THAT WERE PART OF A CUT OF CARS BEINGSET TO DEPART OFF THE NORTH TRIM LEAD.  NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS WERE RELEASED.

KS0403102-d-04-06-03-BNSF.Narrative: THE M AMADEN1 05 TRAIN CREW WAS INSTRUCTED TO DOUBLE THEIR TRAIN FROM 7106 TO 7101 AND REMOVE THREEBAD ORDERS  FROM 7101 TRACK.  DURING THE PROCESS OF SETTING OUT THE THIRD BAD ORDER, THE HEAD END OFTHE TRAIN WAS LOCATED AT THE BOTTOM OF A ONE PERCENT DESCENDING GRADE.  WHILE ATTEMPTING TO SHOVE UP THE HILL AND SECURE THE LAST JOINT, THE ENGINEER  PUT THE UNITS INTO POWER AND RELEASED THE AIR RESULTING IN EXCESSIVE BUFFING FORCES.  NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS WERE RELEASED.

MT0403101-d-04-12-03-BNSF.Narrative: TRAIN X - INBGVE9-09A ENTERED THE YARD AT THE WEST END OF THE NEW YARD AT GREAT FALLS, WESTWARD MOVEMENT, MAIN LINE TO TRACK 124. FOUR LOCOMOTIVES AND 1 CAR HAD PASSED OVER SWITCH TO TRACK 123.  AT THAT  POINT, THE SWITCH TO TRACK 123 OPENED, CAUSING THE FOLLOWING 9 CARS TO DERAIL, DAMAGING TRACK 122, AND 124,.  AFTER INVESTIGATION, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE SWITCH HANDLE ON SWITCH TO 123 WAS DOWN, BUT NOT LATCHED AND THE ENSUING VIBRATION OF THE LOCOMOTIVES AND CARS PASSING OVER THE SWITCH CAUSED THE HANDLE TO LIFT AND THE POINTS TO OPEN.

077640-d-04-04-03-ATK.Narrative: TRAIN NO.#687 OPERATING WITH CC/90220 IN THE LEAD AND ENGINE 820 TRAILING 4 CARS, DERAILED ONE PAIROF WHEELS ON ENGINE 820.  DERAILMENT WAS CAUSED BY WIDE GAGE.  RAILROAD VERIFIED TRACK DAMAGES.
